wikipedia_page.main: John Patrick Campbell (1883–1962) was a Belfast born artist known for his illustrations in publications by members of the Gaelic League  published under the name Seaghan MacCathmhaoil. He was also involved in theatre and related productions. He emigrated to the United States in the early 1910s, and directed the 1913 "Irish Historic Pageant" in New York. His work as a published illustrator or artist seems to have ended by the 1920s.
